website_summaries.verdict: Non-toxic, ready-to-use, fast-acting trap that lures flies and traps them inside.
pros: Attractant designed to lure adult flies and prevent them from multiplying
Safe to use around house or garden because there are no toxic chemicals
Most effective when hung in fly breeding areas, for population control
cons: Fruit-fly-specific, meaning other insects could continue to be problematic

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely useless, this new version sucks
customer_reviews.text: They must have changed the formula of bait or the apple design because these new ones don't do a damn thing! I used the older model terro apple fruit fly traps for years and they worked great. This new version is utterly useless. I've had it out for several days and neither trap has caught a single one!!! The fruit Flys are all around my kitchen and ive seen them sit on the Apple but not a single one has actually made it into the trap.
customer_reviews.author: dizzle

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Our home was infested with fruit flies. As a household of minimal fresh produce and a mostly nitrate rich menu, we were confused and horrified when these tiny, evil bastards took over our house. These apple jobs are LEGIT. Within an hour or less they had captured a good amount of flies. I just bought more.
customer_reviews.author: MotherofChaos

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed that this product did not work at all. We had these out for several days and not one fruit fly was trapped. I later made a homemade solution of apple cider vinegar and dish soap and several fruit flies were trapped within 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: ... original design of the TERRO Fruit Fly traps with great results for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: After using the original design of the TERRO Fruit Fly traps with great results for 2 years, we switched to these updated ones. They have not caught one fly in our house - we have them in multiple rooms and not one has been successful at all. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: StacyK

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: These work great, bananas are horrid attractants for these stupid gnats. Ye, the little gnats start with hanging out on the apple, but in less than 24 hours we had at least a couple dozen dead in the bottom. One of the apples got put upside down and lost the liquid. The second one we just filled with the second bottle the kit came with and the gnats were swarming before I was even done pouring it in. In the picture you can tell which apple had the liquid in it. Since we are now out of liquid we are going to try and refill the first one with apple cider vinegar and dish soap.
customer_reviews.author: ladywoods

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY -- COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I want to confirm the experience of other reviewers who say that this new version does not work. The prior version was great; I could see lots of dead flies when I looked through the bottom after leaving it on my kitchen ledge for a while. The new version does absolutely nothing. I assume they have changed the formula of the liquid you pour inside it. The manufacturer should refund all purchasers' money or send us a replacement consisting of the prior model. I will never buy this again and recommend that you save your money and do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael E. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed - Did not trap a single fly in 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying the Terro T-2500 model of trap for 10 years. Those were great! However, this time I ordered this 2-pack T-2502. It's been 3 weeks and I have yet to find a single insect in the bottom. They are still flying around the house!! I am so disappointed in the T-2502. I plan to contact the company and get my money refunded. Guess I will stick with the T-2500. I cannot explain what the difference is - I can only say one works and the other does not.
customer_reviews.author: K. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I have had this on my counter where the gnats are and not one has flown in. They dp sit on the ledge of it. Buy the product does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: These work butt
customer_reviews.text: I suggest buying a couple packs of these, save the little plastic apples and fill them with apple cider vinegar. Once the solution it comes with ran out, that's what I did. My video is just the apple cider vinegar I added. There stuff worked too but I feel like its the same stuff. So basically buy these cause they look cool and fill with your own stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Simpuhl

customer_reviews.title: Product Does work.👍
customer_reviews.text: These do work. Trapped lots of fruit flies over a 3 week period (yes,I had a problem). Didn’t see where you could purchase additional fruit fly attraction solution so I decided to make my own. I know could have done that in the first place. But these little apple containers are so cute and you don’t need to create some type of container with plastic wrap and rubber bands which looks awful in the kitchen. For me it’s worth the money to get the apple containers.
customer_reviews.author: Bywater

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST fruit fly trap!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best fruit fly trap I’ve ever tried, so I’ll stick to this from now on. As soon as I put these apples at the sink, they attracted all the flies. They were not even interested in the dishes in the sink or the fruit bowl anymore!! DONT BUY THE ONE WITH THE POWDER, that doesn’t do ANYTHING! The flies are totally not interested in that one.. This one has liquid and it makes an enormous difference. Especially this Terro brand one, because I tried other liquids and they were ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: SarvS

customer_reviews.title: Listen to the reviews that say it doesn't work... it DOESN'T.
customer_reviews.text: Flies partied on device's outside, but only a few fell or jumped in. They lingered everywhere, even the cats' dishes. After the fruit was put in the fridge, I kept finding dead flies in it. They even travelled to the living room to dive bomb me. A few got smashed as my aim and targeting improved. But, I looked like a broken human windmill. Unless you have highly formed hand-batting at miniscule flying demons skills, look elsewhere... I know I will. I now need to hunt down the product purchased years ago. It was almost miraculous. They came, they sniffed, they died. If you want to waste money on something useless, send it to a politician.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Y.

customer_reviews.title: DIdn't work for me, an alternate suggestion...
customer_reviews.text: What else can I say? I didn't work, at all. The liquid smells like vinegar, but after 4 weeks not a single victim. Apparently it works for some, but not for us. I will say that the electric fly-swatter I bought was WAY more effective and fun. 9 fruit fly/gnats in 15 minutes, the rest were picked off one by one along with abatement measures.
customer_reviews.author: Chad B.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I previously used a different product that was very effective, but they changed the formula (why?!?!?) and it stopped working, so I tried these. I was hopeful, based on some reviews, but alas, it's essentially worthless. Here is my free, DIY solution: get a pan with a lid, put something in it that the flies like (banana peel, splash of wine, etc), and leave the lid open a crack. Several times a day, close the lid which traps all the flies inside, take it outside and open to release them, and return the lid to the cracked position inside. It's annoying, but it actually works, unlike this worthless product.
customer_reviews.author: Cbus43206

customer_reviews.title: Save some $$ and get the Springstar BioCare Gnat Stix
customer_reviews.text: Toooo bad.... These didn't seem to work for us at all. I'd ordered as a secondary line of defense for gnats that were living in our newly potted plants' soil. Our first line of defense, Springstar BioCare Gnat Stix, I thought were a joke. However, after a weekend the little yellow sticky pads were FULL of gnats. Conversely, these little apples just sit around and smell like vinegar. They seem to have no effect on the gnats. Save some $$ and get the Springstar BioCare Gnat Stix (a surprise because I LOVE Terro products for ants).
customer_reviews.author: EMD

customer_reviews.title: Do not work!!!
customer_reviews.text: This does not work. I have had these set out for 9 days now and not a single fly has been trapped by them. The flies seem to love them and within minutes of putting them out they each had 3 or 4 flies sitting on the lip and 9 days later the flies seem to just love to sit on these things!! Looking inside not a single one has been caught by either trap.... Now I'm going to look into another product because these little things are driving me crazy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel McBride

customer_reviews.title: Buy them!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Nothing else worked and I was so tired of these pesky things!! Def going to order more!!! Edited to add, this is the second time I had to empty/refill bc it filled up with more nasty things! Thought we were in clear but look how tiny some of these are!!!! Omg lol so gross, but still working! Added more pics
customer_reviews.author: Jason Brice

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, but needed help
customer_reviews.text: I placed one of these on a table on top of and in the middle of one of those sticky fly trap papers, and Wow, what a mess of fruit flies in only 24 hours. Both the trap was filled, and the paper around the trap was flooded with dead fruit flies. Had to take away one star, because it doesn't come with much of the bait, and I had to empty the trap quickly and refill it to keep catching more. Can't find it on Amazon for refill either. Seems to work much better than vinegar or other "home remedy" fruit fly baits.
customer_reviews.author: Narg

customer_reviews.title: Good to have if you are consistently working on the problem
customer_reviews.text: This DOES trap and kill fruit flies, but let's say there are 50 flies. It might trap 20. Its a good product, but while using this, it is best to get to the root of the problem at the same time. We poured bleach down ALL our drains once a day and cleaned trash cans out and completely dried them. We also got rid of any moisture and stored fruits they were attracted to in the refrigerator or sealed bowls. We still have them, but the problem is WAAAY better. Also, it smells like vinegar. I will keep the containers, as they are cute and efficient, but will refill with vinegar and water with a touch of dish soap.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Easier to use than homemade products
customer_reviews.text: I recently had an overnight fruit fly infestation in my kitchen and it was disgusting! I made a few homemade fruit fly traps and they worked well, but I wanted something that I could put out and leave without having to constantly change or try to disguise or hide the container. His traps seem to work well and they don’t look bad sitting out on the counters. I have them in other rooms of my house as well, my bathroom my living room and the bedroom that is close to the kitchen. You don’t notice the smell which is slightly vinegary, unless you spell the solution.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda  McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I've been having a problem with fruit flies. I ordered two sets of these (4 traps). After a week, there is only one fruit fly in one of the four traps. There still seems to be some flies buzzing around. I guess I'll try another product. These traps are pretty stinky. Obviously the chemical is at least partly vinegar, as DIY recipes call for. It's not overpowering but it's noticeable within a few feet of the trap. Given the low price compared to other products for fruit flies, I guess it's not TERRIBLE but the phrase "you get what you pay for" comes to mind.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I am vegan and a smoothie drinker, so I have fruit and veggies out 24/7. I had tried to vacuum them up. I had tried to snack them. Then it was like they multiplied with every attempt to eliminate. It was terrible. These took my husband just a couple minutes to set up. Within minutes they were on top of the apples. Within a day 90% of them were gone. Today .... not one fruit fly is on my fruit or veggies! Oh, and the little fake apple trap was placed right next to the fruit and veggies and they chose the trap over the veggies and fruit. WORTH.EVERY.PENNY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Launi

customer_reviews.title: Instability problem solved
customer_reviews.text: This product worked for me as advertised. Five stars. I have caught dozens of fruit flies in the last two weeks and I rarely see one that has evaded the traps. But, due to the shape and/or my clumsiness, I tend to roll them over and spill the liquid when I am moving things around. To enhance the stability, I suggest attaching the bottom of each one to a piece of cardboard, approximately 3" by 3," using either double-sided tape or glue. Since I did this I haven't spilled any.
customer_reviews.author: durangok

customer_reviews.title: Discrete Apple Shape - But Didn’t Work
customer_reviews.text: I liked the apple shape that seemed like it would not only work better, but look better in the home. The problem was they just did not work. The set only came with a small container of the solution that barely filled half of each “apple”. I think I caught maybe 2 or 3 fruit flies before the solution evaporated. Disappointing. During the same time I put out a small bowl of apple cider vinegar with a squirt of liquid dish soap. No need to mix. Caught lots of fruit flies. Save your money and DYI with store bought vinegar and soap. Cheaper and actually works.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. REED

customer_reviews.title: Use a Command Strip to anchor it down
customer_reviews.text: I just got these so I don't know how well they work yet but I like that they don't have any smell and they're small enough to be unobtrusive. When I read the reviews I was concerned about how easy they are to tip over and spill the liquid inside. They are so light I can see how that is a problem. My husband suggested to put a Command Strip adhesive strip on it and it worked beautifully. I put it on the back panel of my stove and it looks really cute there and the Command Strip has anchored it down.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fruit-fly death sentence. Full stop. And, NON-TOXIC!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are like a fatwah on fruit flies. They deserve the reaction you used to see in the old RAID commercials. Fruit flies breed in geometrically-expanding quantities and seem to be able to thrive on leftover cat-sweat once established. These clean them out like nothing else I've used. [TERRO probably won't like my saying so, but I think you can refill them with vinegar (of a certain type?) once you run out of their magic juice, too.]
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh this product is amazing!!! My daughter had a ton of fruit to make a ton of smoothies and of course you know what that means tons of fruit flies!! They over took my kitchen in two days!! It was awful. I bought that expense fan machine with that light for $40 and it worked a little but in less than 24hrs they were nearly all gone!! Even the big flies that came in the open door were attracted to this product!! Definitely recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Flanders

customer_reviews.title: It works! Another one bites the dust😁
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought it because it does work, it just requires a little patience. Do not expect instant results because it takes time for the fruit flies to get to it. I got my trap on Saturday and at first I assumed it doesn't work as after few hours there was no results, the flies were just circling around it and investigating. However, when I woke up the next morning there were 3 flies trapped and another 10 on Monday! Give it a fair chance and you should not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: TETORTIZ

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this product for a few years now. Always effective. I've tried other types, but none have worked as well as this one. I do go through quite a few of these during the summer since there's not a whole lot of liquid in the vials and the fruit flies are plentiful. I definitely recommend this over other alternatives. Excellent product and even a lovely design as guests see a little apple rather than a fruit fly trap.
customer_reviews.author: Lily G

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely work to get rid of Fruit Flies!
customer_reviews.text: We had a terrible fruit fly problem in our house. No matter what we did they seemed to be everywhere. In the past we used apple cider vinegar in shallow dishes that would attract them and they would die in it. For some reason that was not working this time. I bought these out of desperation and they worked so well! Even better there isn't the awful smell of apple cider vinegar everywhere! I don't know that they last 45 days as it appears liqiud dried up already but they are still worth it. I will definitely be buying more. Added bonus they look pretty cute sitting out and can't tell they are full of dead fruit flies.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: New design (multi holes) is flawed
customer_reviews.text: Although flies may get trapped inside, that's not to say it's 100%. I set-up some of these, and expected them gone by end of week, just like its predecessor. After leaving out for a couple more weeks, it was like more flies manifested. I ultimately realized that flies were crawling out of the multiple holes (as opposed to the previous single hole design). Not only are some of the original flies able to exit but I'm guessing it was more of a breeding ground which is why the population grew. I'm going back to original design
customer_reviews.author: la-shopper

customer_reviews.title: Ew! It works!
customer_reviews.text: My plant was attracting fruit flies in my home... so I decided to place the little apple on the soil of the plant and OMG it got so many of those buggers! Somehow, there still manages to be one or two that are impossible to kill, but I can't imagine how many there'd be in this house if it didn't kill those ones! Blegh, so gross. I can't stand Fruit Flies. Anyway, this works the best compared to home remedies I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Alana

customer_reviews.title: Simple but effective
customer_reviews.text: These are basically nothing more than a fancy version of the tried-and-true home method of getting rid of fruit flies – a bowl of apple cider vinegar. These are slightly better than a standard cup or bowl in that the strawberry shape allows flies to fly in but not easily exit, ensuring that they get stuck in the liquid more easily. It also does a better job of keeping the apple cider vinegar odor down.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Perdue

customer_reviews.title: VERY HELPFUL
customer_reviews.text: AArghh! They're moving from my kitchen into my dining room. These traps don't catch all, but they have caught over 50%. I think they're basically vinegar with a dash of oil or soap. I have a Catchmaster 904 Bug & Fly Clear Window Fly Trap on my countertop which helps. The zapperwin 2 Zapper Plug is in transit to hopefully finish the job. If not, I'll try a live lizard next..
customer_reviews.author: MettaMan

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to fruit flies
customer_reviews.text: We have suddenly had a huge infestation of all kinds of insects in our kitchen which is not the most ‘appetizing’. So we purchased a bunch of traps to help us alleviate the problem. These tiny apples have been placed right by our fruit bowl and atleast a dozen fruit flies have been captured in a day. They were driving us crazy between the trash and the ripening fruit so now we have a little more sanity in the house (picture a grown man cursing out the flies and getting super excited to squish one!)
customer_reviews.author: Anisha Agarwala

customer_reviews.title: These are meant as disposable - what a waste!
customer_reviews.text: The product comes with "attractant" that one squirts into the traps. However, these traps are meant to be disposed of, rather than refilled. No one needs a chemical attractant; beer, wine, or vinegar works fine. It's unfortunate that this product adds to landfills. I would much rather be able to empty out the drowned fruit flies and refill with a bit of cider vinegar, and repeat this cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Feisty Brain

customer_reviews.title: Great for the convenience
customer_reviews.text: Nothing about this product isn't something you could make on your own, but the convenience of buying it "pre-made" is worth it, in my opinion. The mixture is basically the standard "fruit fly catcher" of vinegar and soap, and the little apples are the same funnel and cup principle. But I didn't want to fuss with creating the structure, so I was happy to purchase them premade. I will definitely keep using the apples and refill with soap and vinegar after I run out of what they provided.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Thorkildsen

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Don’t hesitate.
customer_reviews.text: There is no adhesion, rather a liquid the fruit flies are attracted to. I placed both around the house and within 24 I had at least 25 between the two. (I have cleaned and checked everywhere for the source but having kids it could be anywhere). Anyway, really solid product and highly recommend. It even has “windows” so you can see if you got any (like the bottom of a juice box).
customer_reviews.author: Audone

customer_reviews.title: Works, BUT
customer_reviews.text: These did work BUT I won't buy them again because they are so messy. The attractant smells VILE. You pour the attractant into the apple shaped containers, which are studded with holes and top heavy. Within 20 minutes of putting them out, one got bumped and instantly there was that awful smelling attractant all over! What a mess! They only give you enough attractant for one shot, with no idea where to buy more, so that one yhat spilled was done. After a couple of weeks, the other had dried up and was tossed as well. I did see reduction of those fruit flies, so that was good.
customer_reviews.author: V. Warren

customer_reviews.title: New design awful
customer_reviews.text: The terro fruit fly traps used to be the best for all sizes of fruit fly infestations. I've used the old design to clear sizeable infestations from hidden food and small little irritations from flys coming in on bananas. Unfortunately the new design is utter crap. The updated design doesn't catch a single fly. They're similar to the raid fruit fly traps in design, and you can read the awful reviews from those to see how awful they work. It's a pity the design changed because they really used to be top shelf traps. Now they're a useless waste of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product-this wannabe apple is a waste of your money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible waste of money. I got this an the fruit flies were least interested in this wanna be apple and low quality liquid I put into it. This product was absolutely unable to kill ANY of the fruit flies. I ended up buying another product -Beapco-which was more expensive but I couldn't take these flies anymore and this was clearly not cutting it. After purchasing the other product, my fruit fly situation was resolved within 24 hours. I wish I could give this product less then one star-that is how BAD this is! Don't waste time or money on this!
customer_reviews.author: yanez

customer_reviews.title: Two for this price? I'd pay double.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I thought for the price I would get 1. It does come with 2 as advertised and one bottle of solution that will fill up each one. After just 1 hour I have a fruit fly victim waiting to take the bait. I have no doubt this will turn out great! I will re update with pictures in 45 days or until one or both are full of fruit flies. We go through tons of bananas and other fruits plus potatoes that don't always get used before they go bad (I know we're disgusting), so I expect plenty of potential victims. Update already! The fruit fly did climb in and drown already.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Don’t work
customer_reviews.text: These didn’t work at all. We had gotten some produce from an organic place and it brought in a lot of fruit flies. We ordered these because they said best selling. They aren’t best working. The minute they came I set them up. Now they have been up for 2 nights. They haven’t caught a single fruit fly. My hubs and left his cup of coffee out last night and woke up to 3 dead ones in it when he went to dump it. Yet the traps- right next to the produce remain empty with fruit flies everywhere. Spend a little extra and get something that works. These do now work at all.
customer_reviews.author: JAMC

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the previous version
customer_reviews.text: I remember when I was living in the dorm, there were lots of fruit flies so I bought Terro Fruit Fly traps at Walmart. It worked really good! This time when I saw serval flies in my apartment, I ordered this fly trap immediately. This version looks cool but didn’t work really well. There is only one fly inside the trap but I still see some fruit flies flying around in the kitchen. Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Yiqing Zhou

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but refills not readily available.
customer_reviews.text: The Pros: 1. small and inconspicuous, more convenient than the traditional open dish 2. easy to fill and place 3. seems to catch fruit flies as well as other methods 4. *a mixture of vinegar, sugar and wine could be used for refills. The Cons: 1. refills aren't readily available [*though a mixture of apple cider vinegar, wine and sugar could be used instead which is actually a plus.] 2. I gave 2* for scent because I couldn't detect any, which was a plus not a minus for me but maybe not others. 3. I gave 2* for value for money because the traditional method is cheaper but less convenient.
customer_reviews.author: J. McJakome

customer_reviews.title: Sweet sweet death
customer_reviews.text: Had a fruit fly problem and these things slaugher those little annoying flying you-know-whats. I was going to forgo these and use the can of OFF and a lighter trick, but really didn't feel like risking the whole burning down the kitchen thing, nor did I want to get scolded by my better 1/2. Furthermore, pick these puppies up and look inside and see the genocide. If you hate fruit flies, want to commit mass murder, and watch these little guys float in a river of death this product is for you.
customer_reviews.author: mlars85

customer_reviews.title: WORKS.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. Smells a little awful but that's the point – like mostly apple cider vinegar but with a touch of rotten meat maybe? Pulled this out and had a fruit fly in it within the first several minutes! The design is great – compact and the flies can't escape. I wish you could just buy a screw top version of this that you can fill with apple cider vinegar because that would be plenty effective. It allows the flies to get in easier than the traditional bowl of apple cider vinegar with saran wrap and holes punched in the top.
customer_reviews.author: Chong Chong

customer_reviews.title: WORKS! REALLY DOES!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I thought this was too good to be true for the price. I watched some reviews on the internet and I pulled the trigger on these tomato lookin things. Within 2 days I had gnats in both of the tomato things using the solution. I'm going to order more of these things at this price! I place one of them by each sink in the house. It seems that's where there making love and procreating. I ordered some high tech blue light machine thing and it didn't pick up one gnat. I TELL YOU FOR 7 BUCKS OR SO THESE WILL WITHIN 1 DAY GET GNATS! BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Covfefe

customer_reviews.title: Worked in one day, sent 32 to their deaths!
customer_reviews.text: We had a fruit fly outbreak at my office, due to piece of food that was left in an outlying office garbage can for two weeks! We tried other methods, including hunting them down ourselves, but I got desperate and ordered these traps online. They arrived in two days, we set them up in the office, and 24 hours later we had captured and killed 32 fruit flies! I could not be happier with this product, and I can't for the life of me figure out why people left so many 1-star reviews - maybe they didn't have fruit flies and the traps don't work for other kinds of flies?
customer_reviews.author: K. Schwehm

customer_reviews.title: DIY methods work better
customer_reviews.text: These were less effective than putting out a plastic cup with apple cider vinegar and a chunk of fruit and covering it with plastic wrap with a small hole poked in it. I got these because they looked better than the plastic cups, but they did not work. I watched the fruit flies go in and fly back out. And my toddler kept knocking them over. (There is a large hole in th center) We put these away and replaced with our DIY ones and the fruit flies were gone. Save your money, the DIY plastic cup and plastic wrap trap works better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: caught 75 flying POS in 2 days!!!
customer_reviews.text: Received the fruit fly traps in the mail 2 days ago (50% off... what a deal!) Placed one in the bathroom and one near our stairs (both areas connect to the kitchen.) Oh .. my we have caught about 75 flies in total with these traps. This is about how many we caught with home made apple cider vinegar & mason jar traps in the past month!! Placing them right out side of the kitchen seemed to help lure them away from our eating space too!!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Magers

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed that the directions said along the lines of discard after use. I thought it might screw apart for cleaning and reuse. However It worked. The first day I thought they were just going to crawl on it, but the next day there were so many fruit flies floating. Still had a few fruit flies so couple of weeks, I just turned it upside down in the trash to empty and refilled with ACV. Looks much better than the tacky jars with wrap, funnels etc that get knocked over.
customer_reviews.author: Sunrise

customer_reviews.title: Very effective- see photo! Also reusable!
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo effective. I had NO idea what a ridiculous amount of fruit flies we had. The solution that comes is very effective but basically smells like apple cider vinegar. I have just opened them, dumped them out, replaced with apple cider vinegar, and they still work great. Being reusable it's a really good investment. And the little window on the side shows if you caught any so u dont have to open it each time. To the company: apples are cute but if you made these in just like gray circles or something that blended away with certain decor they would be even better!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wyk

customer_reviews.title: Constantly falling over, and juice provided is not as effective
customer_reviews.text: I wish that they stayed put a little better, I actually spilled the containers twice and it's funny because the fruit flies didn't even gravitate toward them more than the can of soda in the recycle. It's a cute design but it's pretty flimsy. I looked it up after spilling all the liquid and you can make your own from vinegar and soap. They work ok but I wouldn't get them again.
customer_reviews.author: WSC Boys!

customer_reviews.title: Works great-- wish I could be refill liquid
customer_reviews.text: These worked great to get the knats out of our kitchen. My only complaint is that I can't find where to buy a refill Terro liquid after I cleaned them out. I think they aren't meant to open and re-use, but I'm not about to buy another set of plastic apples. So wasteful. Terro needs to offer the replacement liquid for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MamaJ

customer_reviews.title: Really Does the Job Quickly
customer_reviews.text: The darn little gnats were taking over my home. Lettuce rotted in a bag in the drawer of my fridge and I did not realize where they were coming from. Got these 2 little apples, put some of the liquid in each and just watched the apples get full of the little flies. Problem gone in 3 days, but had to put more out to catch the residuals that flew all around the house. Great stuff. Wish they sold refills of the liquid killer as each fly lays 500 eggs each time and they come from the drains and trash. I had to order more, but this is months later.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Cameron

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: This summer has been a nightmare with mosquitoes and fruit flies. I can't put so much as an orange or apple on the counter because of fruit flies. I went in search of something to trap them and found the TERRO Fruit Fly Traps. They come two to a package in the shape of a tomato along with a small bottle of solution for pouring into the trap. Half of the solution goes into each trap. It took about 24 hours to start seeing results, but it works. There are a few still flying around, but the general population is in the solution. I placed these where I saw the most fruit flies. A great item!
customer_reviews.author: S. Warfield

customer_reviews.title: Practical
customer_reviews.text: These definitely work. The only thing is, based off of the smell it seems as if the main ingredient is apple cider vinegar... I’m not a bug expert but I recently had a lot of fruit flies and 90% flocked to this and died within an hour. I don’t know that I would want to leave an open container with apple cider around my fruits with dead flies everywhere to save money... so I still think the look and idea is very practical.
customer_reviews.author: Glitz

customer_reviews.title: Not very effective
customer_reviews.text: We live in the country and had a big problem with fruit flies and other tiny flies. We tried these and they didn't really do the job. They caught a few flies but not enough to eliminate the problem. We ended up getting an electric device with a UV light and fan that attracted the bugs, sucked them in and stuck them to a glue pad, trapping them by the hundreds. Much more cost effective
customer_reviews.author: Thea Bee

customer_reviews.title: Not quick but it works.
customer_reviews.text: This is not going to get the job done in a matter of even a couple days but I have noticed a reduction in fruit flies. I didn't expect this to solve my problem in a day or two but so far it does appear to be working. Considering the price as well, it's definitely a cost-effective solution.
customer_reviews.author: FinestHops

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: While this product is extremely easy to use, if you've had a fruit fly problem for over a week, this won't get rid of all the bugs by itself. You may need to purchase multiple orders of this trap. Personally while I think this is a good option for when you first notice fruit flies, I have found the sticky glue traps to be the most effective approach when there are many flies around.
customer_reviews.author: BookNerd

customer_reviews.title: Mostly worth it
customer_reviews.text: Works for about a 1-2 weeks I've found from buying a few times. Far less than they say it does but thats usually ok as it will catch/kill the bulk of your flys by then, namely the breeding female ones; then just a matter of waiting till the males die off the next 1-2 weeks. If you can buy this under $10 go for it because it's far more effective then those indoor colored light traps.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive about purchasing these but I am very very happy I did! Within a few hours I could already tell there were less fruit flies in my apartment, and within a day or two they were essentially gone! The evidence is visible in the little clear windows and I was shocked at how many actually were caught. I believe the solution is an Apple cider vinegar type mixture, much like the “home remedies” you read about online. I will likely just refill them with my own solution but I like these little traps much better than the trashy empty water bottle and saran wrap traps you see online that hardly work and make a mess.
customer_reviews.author: elynch21

customer_reviews.title: Good but need Kensizer dual sided adhesive to trap the flies
customer_reviews.text: It’s not only cute but the lure definitely attracts the fruit flies. However these are way to clever to fly inside the trap. So i advise if you also need to stick dual sides stickers to trap the fruit flies. Link below and the results are amazing . I managed to have tones of these flies trapped to the yellow adhesive once they get near the lure ( image attached). Kensizer 10-Pack Dual-Sided...
customer_reviews.author: Amazonfreak

customer_reviews.title: PLEASANTLY SURPRISED!
customer_reviews.text: When I got these in, I was dubious as to whether they would really work in fighting my fruit fly problem, which quickly got out of hand in my kitchen. Wow, was I surprised! After I opened them and put the fruit fly bait in the traps, I placed them on my kitchen counter in 2 locations. At first I saw the fruit flies sitting on top of it and I thought, "I doubt these will work." Just overnight I noticed a huge difference and within 2-3 days all my fruit flies were no more! WOW! Great low price product & it works!
customer_reviews.author: Pattyknows

customer_reviews.title: Best Trap Available!
customer_reviews.text: I tried 5 different traps and home solutions to get a fruit fly problem under control. This was the cheapest and best solution of all of them! The Raid version that looks similar did nothing. The giant white triangle one is hard to tell if it's effective because there is no window to see what's been killed. I put these out and immediately had tons of dead flies a couple hours later. They are also very small and easy to put out several without clutter. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alexi Darling

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Works well but it takes a little while. I placed these 4 of these in our office at work when the people next door would NOT stop putting food in a dumpster just outside our shop (horrible fruit fly infestation ensued). These helped to trap and kill many, many flys. Although I did have to put a label on every one of them that said “DO NOT TOUCH” because apparently, it’s red color and smelly liquid begs people to pick up and SHAKE them In curiosity. 🤦🏼‍♀️ That’s the only downside, but clearly not the fault of the trap. Pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Chasteen

customer_reviews.title: Save your money - these don't work
customer_reviews.text: These were very ineffective. We had a very sudden infestation of fruit flies due to some infested soil in a new house plant. Though we bought two sets and put all 4 out, the problem quickly escalated. We then got a UV light/sticky board trip and the Zevo spray, and the problem was gone practically overnight. When we opened these apples up prior to throwing them away, each had only 2-3 flies inside whereas the sticky board was coated in one night.
customer_reviews.author: QueenofDrama

customer_reviews.title: A great fruit fly problem stopper in an attractive container!  Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: The fruit fly critters, after 2 days of use are GONE! No longer flying through the kitchen. Plus, the attractive little Apple shapes that hold the liquid bait, keep that bait with all the dead fleas in it our of view. Thank GOD we are done with them!
customer_reviews.author: Deb Lindstrom

customer_reviews.title: worthless other than making your room smell like a carcass
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work......AT ALL. Instead, what you get is room that smells like rotting flesh burning your nostrils everywhere you go. Apparently this is a new 'design'.....a piece of plastic with holes in it that you pour vinegar into..........uhm....erm brilliant....piece of trash. This couldn't have worked worse. I bet this couldn't catch a fly even if the swarm was as dense as an arctic blizzard. Actually, wait, it might catch one fly....I do admit that.....and then it flies right back out. Flush this product from existence.
customer_reviews.author: Knowledge Online

customer_reviews.title: Not very effective - Use Apple Cider Vinegar / dribble of dish washing liquid in smooth bowl or cup
customer_reviews.text: Not very effective - Use Apple Cider Vinegar / dribble of dish washing liquid in smooth bowl or cup - much better/cheaper. Some Terro products Very Good. This isn't one of them. Smooth bowl or cup, Apple Cider Vinegar and a dribble of dishwashing fluid (I used apple scented dwd). They circle like O'Hare Airport on a busy day and die in droves - much cheaper. Love their mouse traps, didn't like fruitfly traps at all.
customer_reviews.author: Avg Joe

customer_reviews.title: Buy these if you want to watch fruit flies party and mate on top of them
customer_reviews.text: I started using these for fruit flies (obviously) a few weeks back and I still have them... they just party on top of these apples for the most part. I literally have seen them humping on top of them! Thumbs down for the most part on these things, although there were a lot of dead ones in there so they kind of work. I had ordered some different ones a couple years back and can’t find them now. Those traps worked miracles. I wish I could find them again and put a link right here to something that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: leah brunt

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely works.
customer_reviews.text: I have both of these by the kitchen sink as I suspect there is a permanent colony of gnats living in the crevices of our rentals garbage disposal (tried everything to kill them to no avail). It’s worked wonders in keeping them in check. When the juice that came with it ran out I refilled it with a mixture of apple cider vinegar/water and a dash of soap. The gnats love them and I love seeing them floating dead through the little viewing windows on the side.
customer_reviews.author: D'Anemone

customer_reviews.title: These things work!!!
customer_reviews.text: These work great! We buy a lot of fruits and veggies regularly so I wasn’t surprised when we ended up with fruit flies. It very quickly turned into an infestation with hundreds of flies in my kitchen and in a bedroom around my rabbit cage. I ordered these traps because my homemade traps didn’t work and these ones worked very well! Within 3-4 days I didn’t see anymore flies!
customer_reviews.author: UrFavuritGirl

customer_reviews.title: What a Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I really was looking forward to receiving this product to help control flies in my house. Right now the weather in Phoenix is quite beautiful & allows for windows & sliding glass doors to be open to let in the cool, fresh air from the outside--but that includes flies. This product doesn't work at ALL in capturing and controlling flies--although it did attract and killd a roach. I'm very disappointed in this product and feel as if I completely lost my investment in buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: PNR16

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: A terrible product...caught 0 gnats...followed directions exactly. Each day I checked, nothing! I think the formula was changed-I had bought these 2 years back, and it attracted and caught the gnats--not this time. After 5 days I emptied the liquid (what was left as half had evaporated) and filled with cider vinegar...caught a couple...I gave up and bought a bug light zapper--there you go! finally! So, I highly recommend you do not buy these traps!
customer_reviews.author: char307

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: All this does is stink. It smells just like the apple cider vinegar and dish soap remedy I was already making before I ordered these. The fruit flies were crawling all over and around the "apple" but were not entering the holes. I caught more of them by putting apple cider vinegar and water in a plastic container and just letting it sit out. I have also caught many by placing the mixture in a cup and placing a sticky trap in the cup. These are yellow sticky traps that I purchased from amazon. This product is trash!
customer_reviews.author: Protegé

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic, well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a $40 fan device to kill fruit flies but in a single day this Terro trap killed more fruit flies than the fan device did in a week. I ordered a couple more so I could have one in each bathroom and also 2 in the kitchen, 1 by the trash barrel and 1 by the sink. After only a few days I've gone from seeing a fruit fly every hour to maybe 1 a day. In a few more days I probably won't see any at all especially since I've made sure to kill any eggs in drains with bleach.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, but not effective
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and conceals the bugs it catches. Unfortunately I find it works only just as well as a cup of sugar water though.
customer_reviews.author: DanE

customer_reviews.title: Great! Improvement in one day.
customer_reviews.text: Kept the fruit flies away for about a month! I used these in the break room at work, where there were always some sort of fruit flies around. They just started to resurface after about a month though, so I think I’ll be purchasing more of these! (I don’t think most people would have to repurchase after a month, however. My work break room is just gross.. and the people don’t clean up after themselves.. So I’d imagine that the 2-pack of these traps would suffice for most.)
customer_reviews.author: Jay4743

customer_reviews.title: Best Trap Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic - a very efficient way to get rid of pesky fruit flies! I had read about it in an article of the top 20 unusual finds on Amazon. I don't think of it as unusual, but it is definitely in my top 20. I live in the South, and summertime always means fruit flies, no see-ums, gnats, beach flies and all other miniature flying creatures. At least I have a way to combat the fruit flies!
customer_reviews.author: Carla B

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS ASAP!
customer_reviews.text: I saw so many mixed reviews but for the price I decided it was worth the risk of losing a few bucks. This product is AMAZING. Worked wonders right away. 2 days later we’re gnat free. Will be recommending this to everyone! Not sure why there are bad reviews on this item, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: javier castillo

customer_reviews.title: Cute but useless
customer_reviews.text: Having used Terro ANT baits in the past with excellent results, I disregarded all of the negative reviews for this product and decided to give it a try. Boy was I wrong. I left two of these out for one week. I set one beside the fruit bowl and one on the edge of the sink. Over the past week, they caught exactly TWO fruit flies. My glass of wine has caught more in the past five minutes than these did in eight days. What a bummer. I've thrown them out and advise that you look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: KatieBirdTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work at all! - Update below***
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these traps out for a week... haven’t caught a single fruit fly. Waste of money! *** Update: These didn't work for the first 5 days I had them, so I stashed them in my laundry room. A few days later while I was cleaning, I accidentally knocked one over and it had caught about 8 fruit flies. So maybe it depends on where you place them? I then put one next to my sink and haven't caught one there... Not sure what the difference is aside from placement.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Holcombe

customer_reviews.title: As always, they work.
customer_reviews.text: At the beginning of every summer I get an onslaught of knats. I have tried many different ways to get ride of them. From store bought to home remedies. Most if not all work to some extent. But none of them work as well or as fast as these traps. I put them in the kitchen and within minutes the knats start gravitating towards them. After a few hours I no longer notice them and I am in at free until the next summer.
customer_reviews.author: Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Will clear an infestation and is good for maintenance
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! This is my second time buying them. The first time I had an infestation and it cleared up in about a week. The first couple days it only caught one fly and I was pretty discouraged but then it just started collecting more and more. I just set this second set up and even though I don't have an infestation they're still around and it's already caught some! 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Great, Effective little product.
customer_reviews.text: I love these little fruit fly traps! They are small and cute enough to place in my kitchen window sill or around anyplace where I might have fruit, compost scraps, and/or chicken scraps. Because I do a lot of canning and dehydrating, I've often got a bushel of fruit or veggies in the kitchen. Last year, I had an epidemic of fruit flies and gnats, so I began using these early in the season. So far, I've only seen a fruit fly here or there, but they never last more than a day or two. Great little product.
customer_reviews.author: smizell49

customer_reviews.title: Sewer flies
customer_reviews.text: I live in condo conversion and the building is 51 years old. I share plumbing with 7 other units and sometimes little sewer flies come up from the drain. These aren't fruit flies - they are harder to kill. But these traps work like a charm. I replace them every 90 days and it really helps regulate the problem. I have noticed these little apples in commercial places like bars too, you can tell that these are a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia C

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Only works halfway. I have no idea why some fruit flys are trapped and dead in these but others just hang out flying around it or sitting on top of it. It is disappointing that the mixture apparently isn’t strong enough to attract and kill all of them. At least these weren’t very expensive but we are going to have to look for a better option.
customer_reviews.author: wtrowbridge

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, what’s not to love about it?! It’s great!
customer_reviews.text: It works awesome. Would love if they sent a little more product to add or a refill..but hey, it’s cheap and works awesome! Here is a pic. You see them on top of it and lots inside it..it works. Just take the fruit and veggies out of the kitchen or wherever so they go to this and not the fruit. OR buy fruit bags while this thing does it’s magic. Or have more fun and buy a bug a-salt and declare war. I did both and it was great success!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Crew

customer_reviews.title: Just plain terrible
customer_reviews.text: I watched gnat and fruit fly time and time again fly in and fly out of this contraption. It has yet to capture a single insect. I am amazed at just how terrible this little apple works. I had high hopes about this little device. The "special" liquid they use is apple cider vinegar. You can make your own trap with that and some cellophane and a cup. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Frequency JonesTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: DIY traps work better
customer_reviews.text: This trap looks the part and seems like it should work, but I'm disappointed. This same brand is available at most hardaware and home improvement stores. The issue it that fruit flys seem to be afraid to fly into it becuase the holes to get into the bait are more like tunnels. I created a trap with saran wrap and a plastic cup that works fifteen times better. The design could probably be tweeked to make this a 5-star product. The little pests just don't seem to want to commit to entering these little traps as it stands.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Despite the reviews it really works
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product and then I read the reviews. I need to confess I was a little worried. The product arrived and I decided to use it and give it a try, I left it one in the kitchen and because of the reviews I thought I was not going to catch any flies, for my surprise on the next morning there was 8 dead flies in the trap so I’m giving 5 stars .
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Silva

customer_reviews.title: Fruit-fly Solution!
customer_reviews.text: If you have fruit fly problems these are great. Non toxic, no odor if you don’t put your nose real close (vinegary if you do, not bad). When they dry up I have added a tiny bit of water and they work fine. Once, maybe twice and then a new one. Def a new one if too many dead bugs. Innocuous appearance set behind the banana holder on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Kate  Smith

customer_reviews.title: Finally, something that works!
customer_reviews.text: I used to fashion traps out of glasses with red wine and saran wrap. They would work some of the time, but were ugly. These little guys look indiscreet, and you can put them on top of the soil in plants, next to the sink, or on the dining room table and they don't look out of place! Bought a pair, then came back for two more pairs a week later.
customer_reviews.author: Bex

customer_reviews.title: Wow, no more fruit flies, anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: These came the day after I ordered them. We'd had such an outbreak from my recent squash binge that we could barely walk in the kitchen w/o being attacked. I didn't even want to eat in my own home. I put the first one up and it was full in 24 hours, the fruit fly population massively cut down. I set up the other when the first reservoir was full, by the next day. We're fruit fly free, entirely! It didn't take but a couple of days either. I'm pretty thrilled, best six bucks I've ever spent!
customer_reviews.author: Javagoddess

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY $$
customer_reviews.text: This product is basically a cute plastic apple that has holes where you pour in nothing more than apple cider vinegar. I'm not sure if that is what is in the bottle that is included in the package, but that is what it smells like. And it only caught one little gnat. I gave it a week and then I bought some yellow gnat/fly traps that have stakes to go in your plants and caught almost 100 gnats in 2 days. Don't waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Flannery

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 2pks because we have gnat issues for some reason they’ve gotten into our potted plants. I’ve had all 4 out around the house where they are most annoying for about a week. Not one gnat in any of them. So disappointed. I’ve used similar traps and they work great. Not sure what the problem is. Maybe remove the top and make my own?
customer_reviews.author: Mel Lo

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! Worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a fruit fly issue and can’t find the source! I had tried everything and finally decided to try something online. I’ve had them out for 48 hours and my problem is gone. It’s absolutely crazy how well these worked instantly! You can see all the little buggers inside.
customer_reviews.author: Kmvds

customer_reviews.title: Great product that really works!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried every trick in the book for fruit and drain flies - and every time I go back to these little traps. They work so well to attract and trap the flies. One day they'll all be sitting on top of it, the next day they're all stuck inside. The liquid does not give off any scent that I can smell when walking by which is great. Once all the flies are gone, I wrap it up and throw it away. I only have to get these once or twice a year usually but every time I do it's so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kiana

product_meta.title: TERRO T2502 Fruit Fly Trap – 2 traps
product_meta.description:
Item Package Quantity:1

Have you spotted fruit flies swarming around your kitchen or garbage can? With the TERRO Fruit Fly Trap, you can get the best of these annoying household pests in no time. This fast-acting trap uses a liquid bait to lure adult fruit flies inside. Flies that enter the trap are unable to escape and continue breeding. This trap features an attractive apple-shaped design that will look at home in any kitchen. Meanwhile, a built-in window allows you to keep an eye on catches and lure levels.

When trying to eliminate fruit flies, the key to success is locating their breeding areas. You’ll typically spot fruit flies swarming around kitchen fruit bowls and near garbage cans. For best results, place traps behind or under kitchen counters, sinks, dishwashers, near unrefrigerated fruits and vegetables, and any other location where fruit is stored.
feature_bullets: Fast-acting trap eliminates fruit fly infestations
Ready-to-use, non-staining lure attracts adult fruit flies
Built-in window allows for easy monitoring of lure levels
Attractive, apple shaped trap blends in with décor
Most effective when placed near common breeding sites
90 day lure supply: Each trap lasts for up to 45 days

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars8,479 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
